answers.answer: I know what you mean.  My pain is in my left arm around the elbow and on top side of arm is a burning pain all day and sometimes i can't get much sleep from it.I was taking beta-blockers for years, but recently had to quit them because theywere causing me to have a very low[drop dead] heartrate.The pain in my left arm started right after i stopped taking the beta-blockers.I have hypertension and a skipping heartbeat, which causes me a lot of anxiety.Sometimes i have anxiety or panic attacks which makes me feel like i am dying.My Dr won't give me but one pill for anxiety to be taken at bedtime, so when i havethe attacks in the daytime i just have to ride it out without any help whatsoever.Only one half of a xanax helps the panic attacks, but he won't give me but 30 per month.I understand that this medication is very addictive and that is why he won't give me but one per day for night-time use so i can get some sleep.But with my arm hurting so bad, i sometimes can't get to sleep anyway.I wish i could find what is causing this burning pain around the elbow area[not joint]and if there is anything that can be done about it.  Thanks!

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!If no neurological cause for pain in the arm is found like a pinched nerve, get a color dopplar to rule out a clot in blood vessel (either thrombophlebitis or deep vein thrombosis). It can also be due to inflammation of the muscles or myositis. Other than that, get a nerve conduction velocity test to know if there is any nerve compression. Metabolic disorders like diabetes, hypothyroidism and low calcium could also be a cause and hence get this checked. Hope this helps. Take care!
